description.en: Internship takes place in one of the selected conflict regions in cooperation with the receiving host institution. During the internship students are informed about the conflict dynamics and settlement perspectives. In-class training lessons include meetings with local experts, politicians and international mediators.
description.et: Praktika viiakse läbi ühes väljasõiduga konfliktipiirkonda ning koostöös vastuvõtva institutsiooniga. Selle käigus saadakse ülevaade konflikti sisust ja lahendamise väljavaadetest, kohtutakse kohalike ekspertidega, poliitikute ja rahvusvaheliste vahendajatega.

objectives.en: The aim is to study root causes and conflict dynamics in one of the selected conflict regions. It takes place in the form of study trip.
objectives.et: Tutvustada  rahvusvahelise konflikti tekke- ja arengulugu mingi kindla juhtumi näitel. See toimub uurimisreisi näol.

learning_outcomes.en: Upon completing this internship, the students
- will gain a comprehensive knowledge about conflict dynamics and settlement perspectives;
learning_outcomes.et: - tunneb konkreetse konflikti arengulugu ja lahenduse väljavaateid;

learning_outcomes.en: - will understand the role of international diplomacy in conflict management and know how to use these practical skills in real life.
learning_outcomes.et: - omab teadmisi rahvusvahelisest diplomaatiast ja konfliktide reguleerimisest ning oskab neid ka praktikas kasutada.

independent_work.et: Fieldwork report: 5 pp, Times New Roman 12, single space.

description.et: Final fieldwork report contains post-tour reflections in the form of essay where one has to link the in-class knowledge with practical experiences from the field.

grade_preconditions.et: To pass the course, one has to attend all the seminars and practice learning exercises, take part in the field trip to conflict region and submit the final report.

debt_elimination.et: Upon the agreement with the instructor.

resources.mandatory_materials: Each seminar has a list of compulsory readings.
resources.recommended_materials: To be specified in due course.
